sen.j: 不落不落、不落々々（ぶらぶら）は、鳥山石燕の妖怪画集『百器徒然袋』に描かれている日本の妖怪の一種で、提灯の妖怪。
sen.e: Burabura is a lantern specter, which is a Japanese specter portrayed in "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro" (One hundred bags in idlenss) by Sekien TORIYAMA.

Burabura is a lantern specter and one of Japanese yokai (ghosts, spirits and monsters) that was portrayed in Sekien TORIYAMA's yokai art collection book: "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro" (The Bag of One Hundred Random Demons; the term 'hyakki' in its title is a pun on the usual hyakki, replacing the character for demon which is written as "鬼" in Japanese with a character for vessel written as "器," and sure enough, most of the yokais shown in this book are tsukumogami [a type of Japanese spirits that originate in items or artifacts that have reached their 100th birthday and become alive]).

sen.j: 『百器徒然袋』中にある石燕の解説文によれば、外観は提灯の火だが、実体は狐火とされている。
sen.e: According to Sekien's commentary in "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro," it appears lantern; however, it is actually a will-o'-the-wisp.
According to Sekien's commentary in the "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro," the Burabura looks like a lantern light, however, it is actually believed to be a Kitsune-bi (a Japanese will-o'-the-wisp).

sen.j: なお提灯の妖怪は有名な割に伝承資料に乏しい。
sen.e: There are few traditional references about the lantern specter although it is a popular specter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。用語集によると鬼火と狐火は同訳でした。
sen.e: There are few references on lore of the lantern yokai despite its popularity.

sen.j: しかし提灯お化けのような妖怪ではなく、狐火や提灯火のような怪火として伝承されていることが多い。
sen.e: However, it may be often passed down as a fire of mysterious or suspicious origin, such as a will-o'-the-wisp.

sen.e: However, the lantern yokai has often been reported not as a Chochin Obake (literally, lantern ghost) but as a fire of mysterious or suspicious origin, such as the kitsune-bi and chochin-bi (lantern light).

sen.e: However, the lantern yokai has often been reported not as a Chochin Obake (literally, lantern ghost) but as a fire of mysterious or suspicious origin, such as the kitsune-bi and chochin-bi (lantern light).

sen.j: 器物の妖怪として描かれていることから、解説文のような狐火の妖怪ではなく、俗にいう提灯お化けの一種と見なす方が妥当とする意見もある。
sen.e: Since it is portrayed as a specter of an object, some say that it should not be considered as a specter of will-o'-the-wisp like described in the commentary, but as commonly known lantern ghost.

Since it is portrayed as a yokai of items and artifacts, some say that it should not be considered as a kitsune-bi yokai as described in the commentary but as a variation of the so-called Chochin Obake.
